main event: On 30th November 1957 in Fairbanks, Alaska, a civilian witnessed a round object with cream and red color, emitting flashes of light similar to blue or pure white, moving at high speeds and emitting a stroke of light.
interesting points: The object displayed color changes from yellow orange to brilliant white to bright blue white.
It emitted pulsating light and was estimated to be at a high elevation with no deviations in its course.
Reports suggest that the sighting involved both ground visual and sky movement observations.
Multiple personnel, including military officers and air defense command, were involved in the investigation.
The object's behavior led to considerations of it being a meteor or possible remains of a Russian rocket, Sputnik No. 1.
sighted object: round cream and red object emitting flashes of light
witnesses: civilian, 11th Air Division personnel, air defense command, and other military officers
